page.title: 12DALBEATTIE'S LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Buittle Castle,}on the outskirts of Dalbeattie,was built about the year 1200.It's in ruins now but once John Balliol lived there before he became King of Scotland.His mother,{Lady {Devorgilla,}founded Sweetheart Abbey in 1273 and later in 1282 founded{ {Balliol College}at Oxford.Her son was nick-named "Toom Tabard" or "Empty Coat". He abdicated under pressure from Edward 1 who had invaded Scotland. {Alexander Copland}and{George Maxwell founded the village of Dalbeattie in 1781.They have streets named after them in their memory. {Lieut.W.Murdoch,}a native of Dalbeattie, was first officer on board the{"Titanic"}when it struck an iceberg and sank in 1912.A prize is awarded annually in his name at Dalbeattie High School.
